--- title: Instances description: Guide for module instances --- *Modules* can be rendered with different instances, allowing a module to be reused many times in one screen while keeping it's own state per instance. ## Module Instances There's 3 ways to work with instances: 1. No instance, then the module will use the *DEFAULT_INSTANCE_ID* ("default") ```js const Counters = () => (
...
) ``` 2. Constant instance ```js const Counters = () => (
...
) ``` 3. Dynamic instance ```js const Counters = ({ instances = []}) => (
{ R.map( instance => , instances ) }
) ``` **Note:** The *Counter* component should be a *connected* component.
